name: Nod-Krai
desc:
The moon-blessed land located in the northwestern regions of Teyvat.

Follow the silver thread spun by the new moon, traverse biting gales and desolate tundras as the snow-kissed lakes, fractured like mirrors, reflect their ageless, glacial radiance. The days are bitterly short, and the night stretches on like a dark, yawning maw. But even then, the light and song of the Welkin Moon will dance gently across the faces of visiting travelers. Up at ye towers, and let your lanterns blaze into the darkness! Until the day comes... when true moonlight bathes this land once more.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>April 25, 2025</color>
The "Palestar Edict," that highest of commands, has gone out. With it, the Fatui Harbingers have been summoned back to Snezhnaya and dispatched to Nod-Krai. The people stare and wonder: for what purpose does this army, bearing the banner of the Pale Star, come to their city? Or perhaps the question should be, "For whom?"

<color=#ffd780>April 26, 2025</color>
The descendants of the legendary golden realm, who chose to find new homes among the mountains and forests after abandoning their ancient civilization. The only thing they never forsook was their faith in the "Moon Goddess." However, with the arrival of the Fatui, it appears that their tranquil lives are about to fade into the realm of yesterday...

<color=#ffd780>April 27, 2025</color>
The ancient organization that has long defended Nod-Krai's freedom and peace against the ceaseless incursions and Wild Hunt attacks launched by the Abyss, now severely weakened from battles past. In the face of new threats, none can say for sure if the new generation of Ratniki will remain able to carry out their mission...

<color=#ffd780>April 28, 2025</color>
The armies of the Abyss sweep across the wilderness and canyons like a storm, and if you venture close enough, you may even hear their eerie whispers. These lost, soulless monsters appear to be silently searching for something...

<color=#ffd780>April 29, 2025</color>
The merchants of Nasha Town formed a commerce guild to maintain basic order. However, how could the outlaws that prowl between the islands be controlled by something as simple as mere rules? It seems that the honor of striking fear into their hearts must go to the boss lady of the "Curatorium of Secrets"...

<color=#ffd780>September 13, 2025</color>
To help Travelers gather some tasty "food intel" during their downtime, Paimon's gone all out, dashing across every corner of this mysterious land...
Thanks to her (totally legit) Gold-Star Reporter instincts, Paimon managed to track down some seriously "big-name" insiders! Let's head to the scene and see what juicy details they shared!
Preview Issue 001 | "Lunology" and You: Blessing of the Moon Goddess

<color=#ffd780>August 30, 2025</color>
Hey, Traveler! Here's a little package just for you... Let's open it together!
Preview Issue 002 | "The Code of Robot Conduct": Sleeping Not Authorized

<color=#ffd780>August 31, 2025</color>
Hello, Traveler!
The second volume of A "Junk"-Scavenging Journey in Nod-Krai is here. Come and take a look now!
Preview Issue 003 | May the Moonlight Bless Your Journey Ahead: A Glowing Companion

<color=#ffd780>September 1, 2025</color>
Hello, Traveler!
The third volume of A "Junk"-Scavenging Journey in Nod-Krai is here. This time, an adorable little friend is joining us! Come take a look~
The Blessing of Moonlight New Team Bonus Effect and Elemental Reaction

<color=#ffd780>September 5, 2025</color>
Greetings, Traveler! Welcome to Nod-Krai, where dreams of paradise and wanderers intersect!
Influenced by the Ancient Moon's Remnants, Nod-Krai is not governed by any of the seven elements. Instead, it is permeated by an ancient form of elemental energy. Over time, those who dwell here have slowly adapted and begun to explore this blessing bestowed by the moonlight...
The Puzzle of Moonlight: Your Must-Read Guide to Exploring This Moonlit World

<color=#ffd780>September 7, 2025</color>
Hello, Traveler!
The abundant kuuvahki in Nod-Krai has affected all living things in this land. The people here have learned to harness its energy, while the flora and fauna have grown rather unusual under its influence.
But worry not, this guide is here to help you! Let's take a look at the things you might wish to pay attention to while exploring Nod-Krai...

customize.name: Ineffa
customize.desc: A multifunctional robot containing integrated mechanical components from various nations. The Source Core in her chest has endured the passage of countless years.

customize.name: Lauma
customize.desc: A Maiden blessed by moonlight and the grove alike, hope born to the Frostmoon Scions.

customize.name: Flins
customize.desc: A Lightkeeper of Nod-Krai, guardian of a lighthouse and graveyard on a northern isle. An enigmatic gentleman, cultured and courtly.

customize.name: Aino
customize.desc: A genius mechanic and inventor from Nod-Krai who loves interesting machines and sweet treats.

customize.name: Snare Hook
customize.desc: The stave of this bow is comprised of metal alloy and yet remains surprisingly light. Even when faced with thick, heavy snares, the arrows it fires can pass through unhindered.

customize.name: Nightweaver's Looking Glass
customize.desc: A mirror crafted from flawless silver that is said to have witnessed the birth of the Moon Maiden. It is seen as a relic of unrivalled provenance by the Frostmoon Scions.

customize.name: Blackmarrow Lantern
customize.desc: A lantern that emits a faint, ghostly glow, contained by a midnight-black alloy that resembles interlocking bones. It is said to have once been revered as a precious treasure by a certain secret organization.

customize.name: Etherlight Spindlelute
customize.desc: A lute whose golden strings are as radiant as sunlight. It appears to be a relic from the Seelie of old.

customize.name: Prospector's Shovel
customize.desc: A polearm that appears to have been crafted from a metal agricultural tool. At first glance, it could not look more ordinary, yet its discreet design hides fittings that are both lavish and undeniably exquisite.

customize.name: Master Key
customize.desc: A heavy greatsword with a razor-sharp blade. Power is a key that can open almost any lock.

customize.name: Serenity's Call
customize.desc: A longsword forged from metal that makes a mournful sound when swung.

customize.name: Moonweaver's Dawn
customize.desc: An immaculate, sharp silver sword that can slice through armor like moonlight flowing through the empty night. According to legend, it is a divine blade, blessed by the first Moonchanter herself.

customize.name: Moonfall Silver
customize.desc:
A silver crystal as pure and pristine as moonlight. It possesses almost perfect elemental affinity.
In the legacy of the Frostmoon Scions, these crystals were born five hundred years ago alongside the Moon Maiden, and were believed by the Moonchanter at the time to be a gift from the moon, hence the name "Moonfall Silver". However, in older documents written by Snezhnayan chroniclers, the descendants of the golden realm were already using secret silver woven by the Frostmoon thousands of years in the past. The threads that connect these two tales are unclear — the only certain thing is that these crystals make excellent elemental conductors in the eyes of Nod-Krai's craftspeople.

customize.name: Portable Bearing
customize.desc:
A portable bearing of a type that was mass-produced after the Fatui moved into Nod-Krai. Excessively worn units are discarded like obsolete personnel.
A few of them have a vestige of kuuvahki left inside. As they are difficult to imitate, they are occasionally used as currency by merchants in Nasha Town.
It's said that people tried to forge these bearings for that reason, but went bankrupt in the end because the cost of forging them was higher than their market value.

customize.name: Frostlamp Flower
customize.desc:
A flower that resembles a candle lamp, commonly found near water. It emits a cold, simple aroma that has a calming effect.
The contrasting colors of its stamen and stem are thought to symbolize the two different types of kuuvahki, yet despite this symbolism, it is one of the few rare plants that are immune to kuuvahki's influence. As a result, the Frostmoon Scions sometimes regard it as a symbol of faithlessness and apostasy.
It is said that this strangely shaped flower first appeared at the end of the dark calamity five hundred years ago, but this claim has never been rigorously verified.

customize.name: Whisper in the Woods
customize.desc: Lauma's specialty. Each ingredient blossoms on the tongue, setting your taste buds to dancing — a flavorful freshness unlike any other. It's as if you can hear birds chirping at dawn, and the gentle sound of dewdrops glistening under the morning sun... Could this be a blessing from the Maiden of the Grove?

customize.name: Clink-Clank Confectionery Cup
customize.desc: Aino's specialty. "Here it comes!" Aino announces, gleefully, as a precariously wobbling dessert makes its way towards you. You take a big bite... and immediately regret it. The overwhelming sweetness nearly numbs your taste buds. Only then does Ineffa's warning surface in your mind — "Please be sure to prevent Aino from entering the kitchen at all costs."

customize.name: Thunderclap Slash!
customize.desc: Ineffa's specialty. Ineffa shouts "Thunderclap Slash!" impassively as krumkakes are launched one after another from her empty arm socket, landing with precision on the plate before you. Intricate patterns and a sweet, delightful flavor confirm the maker's culinary excellence. Your taste buds have no choice but to surrender to the all-conquering "Thunderclap Slash."

customize.name: Icy Pebble
customize.desc:
A pebble commonly found on Nod-Krai's coasts, characterized by a naturally occurring hollow. Touching it sends a faint chill through your finger.
According to ancient legends, the hollows in these pebbles were once shelters revealed to the fae by the Frost Moon — gateways to the ethereal. In another story popular in Nasha Town, the legendary thief, Reed Miller, was surrounded when a runestone given to him by a holy lady of the Frost Moon as a token of her love allowed him to conceal himself and escape his pursuers. Naturally, the Frostmoon Scions vehemently reject this claim, as these pebbles do not display any such magical properties.

customize.name: Nocturnal Blossom
customize.desc:
A flower in two entwined colors with a strong affinity for kuuvahki. Its light fragrance and conspicuous color have made it an excellent natural dye.
Its contrasting colors are thought to symbolize the two different types of kuuvahki, so the followers of the Frostmoon Scions sometimes regard it as the Moon Maiden's blessing.
It is said that this strangely shaped flower first appeared decades after the dark calamity ended five hundred years ago, a claim widely reflected in the verses of the Frostmoon Scions, though it has never been rigorously verified.

customize.name: Rye
customize.desc: The gray-brown ears are a gift from the earth. Their richness can only be brought out by grounding and roasting.

customize.name: Smetana
customize.desc: A dairy product produced through complex processes such as separation and fermentation. It has a smooth texture and a refreshing sourness, often serving as the finishing touch in many dishes.

customize.name: Lakkaberry
customize.desc:
A fruit as white as pearl that tastes refreshingly sweet.
In the legends of the Frostmoon Scions, these fruits, like kuuhenki, are a gift from the Moon Maiden, a sacred symbol blessed by the new moon. Therefore, sharing and eating delicious Lakkaberries is also a form of worshipping Kuutar.
Even when not associated with the divine, their plumpness and sweetness alone are enough to awaken one's appetite.

customize.name: Midsommar Berry
customize.desc:
A fruit that grows in the warmer parts of Nod-Krai. It is beloved by animals emerging from winter and hungry children alike.
In the legacy of the Frostmoon Scions, Midsommar Berries are regarded as a symbol of life and abundance, for they only flourish during the warmth of spring and summer.
There is a tale that tells of the endless struggle between the King of Winter Holly and the King of Summer Oak — twin monarchs that slay each other as the seasons change, returning from the underworld to rule in turn until the end of time. Most Snezhnayan scholars dismiss this as a primitive religious metaphor for the alternating seasons — or at least that's what they tell themselves.

customize.name: Rainbowdrop Crystal
customize.desc:
A crystal that gives off an iridescent glow. Exceptionally tough and malleable, it has been regarded by Snezhnayan craftspeople as the best forging material since ancient times.
It is believed that when the moon's chariot was shattered, its blood-stained axle-tip fell into the earthly realm beneath the moon, transforming into an iridescent crystal. From that day on, the people of this land no longer worshipped the dead gods. The survivors who knew what the monarchs of the night died for, however, still futilely sing those long-forgotten names.

customize.name: Precision Kuuvahki Stamping Die
customize.desc:
A stamping die taken from the wreckage of a defeated Knuckle Duckle — think of it as a keepsake from Aino.
A philosopher from Sumeru once argued that self-replication is a unique characteristic of life, an unparalleled achievement that no man-made object can mimic. The power to reproduce is the key that separates mankind from the divine.
However, if a machine is given an exact mold that it can use to replicate itself, mold included, then can not this too be considered perpetual self-replication? The former master of the silent, blue-haired maid who stands by Aino's side once pondered that same question but ultimately dismissed it out of fear that a perpetually self-replicating machine would consume everything on the planet's surface.
Such problems have never concerned Aino. This machine will not exhaust the world's resources to multiply itself just yet — after all, it's just a duck.

customize.name: Lightbearing Scale-Feather
customize.desc:
The scaly wings shed by a defeated Radiant Moonfly.
In many local folk tales, those who enter the forbidden ground are frequently bewitched by these wings and never seen again. Some say this is because the moon, whose illusory magic these butterfly-shaped monsters have harnessed, is prone to inducing madness, while others take it as a warning of the inconstancy and danger of ancient power...

customize.name: Artful Device Fragment
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
An intricate device once known as the "Seven Tools of the Great Thief." Rumors claim it was created by the legendary thief, Reed Miller.
Just as the first Treasure Hoarders came from all walks of life, this combination of tools meant for different purposes was designed to break down artificial boundaries, regardless of whether they were chains or borders.
It should be noted that there are more than seven tools, its just that people are accustomed to using seven to describe anything numerous. Perhaps it is for the same reason that the world is believed to have only seven forms of order.

customize.name: Artful Device Replica
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Just as the legendary thief's tools have been imitated by countless others, so has his name.
In a sense, it was not the people who thirsted for something more who stole Reed Miller's name, but rather Reed Miller who stole the identity that was originally theirs alone. These viewpoints are just two sides of the same coin.

customize.name: Artful Device Inheritance
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Word on the street is that the legendary thief, Reed Miller, has been sentenced to death several times, yet he's always managed to escape at the last minute with the help of his friends — and his tools.
In some versions of these stories, several of his followers willingly died in his place for their revered King of Elysium. Naturally, these versions can't compete with the more popular drunken stories full of romance and bliss. Since there has never been a shackle that could restrain the legendary thief, it is only natural to assume that no ending could do the same.

customize.name: Artful Device Wish
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
"The poor, the starving, the wretched, the oppressed! My exiled brothers and sisters!"
"If you, too, have tasted indignities at the cruel hands of fate! If you, too, have wept in the night at the plight of your neighbors!"
"If you, too, have longed for a shelter from fear! If you, too, have dreamed of a world where no tears are shed!"
"Then join us, your brothers and sisters, in breaking the chains of slavery!"
"Let the dead bury the dead, for you will rise up, and with the treasures of the haughty, we will build an Elysium without boundaries!"

customize.name: Sundered Glory of the Far-North Scions
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
It is told that in the years before the country of gold and white stone sank, the moon-worshipping ancestors were guided by the star of dawn to build a tower reaching to the heavens.
Later on, the most transgressive of wild fantasies, one to unify life and the world into one, one that even the monarch who ruled all nations on earth failed to achieve, was toppled along with the city in the wrath of the high heavens.
The homeless survivors fled to the south by the waning light of the Frostmoon, chanting in tears of a glory that belonged to them millennia ago.

customize.name: Unyielding Delusion of the Far-North Scions
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The grand city of gold and white stone was no more. Following the moonlight's pale guidance, its exiled inhabitants wandered to a desolate foreign land.
The glory and prowess of the past had dried up like morning dew, yet the earliest delusion still flowed beneath the skin of the proud, unlike the graves now lost to time.
Like farmers breeding their crops, the Archpriestesses who served the moonlight, for generation after generation, selected the purest bloodlines closest to their progenitors, no matter the cost...

customize.name: Oblation of the Far-North Scions
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A blade as pure as moonlight is the compassion of a benevolent hand.
In the name of mercy, all beings offer hope for tomorrow. Even those looking to be made whole can feel the moonlight's pristine blessing flowing beneath their skin. Even the smallest blessings, accumulated, can guide the pious scions immersed in them closer to the coming Elysium.
All sins and wicked thoughts are cleansed by the pristine moonlight, all tears and suffering are necessary sacrifices — at least that is what the people who worship the moon once firmly believed.

customize.name: Aureate Radiance of the Far-North Scions
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With the unblessed birth of the prophesied son, a millennia-long plan ushered in a bleak twilight.
A scheme born of cunning was shattered by foolish betrayal. The youth who was supposed to be king took the maid who was supposed to serve him and stole the secret treasure that was supposed to be his, only to reject the crowns that fate had ordained for him.
In time, the king who was destined to rule Elysium went down in history as an unpardonable thief, and by the time the true new moon shone upon the land, the far north's final wish of golden grandeur had already been buried by a priestess, who had never believed in any god, in the empty grave of her king.

customize.name: Ember of Long Night Flint
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
In earthly poetry, light is often a metaphor of hope. The fires burn out in silence, only to reveal the onward path in the darkness before dawn.
Regardless, neither the first Torchforger nor the friend with whom he painted Elysium as a child ever knew where the illuminated path would lead until the moment the lights were extinguished.

customize.name: Afterglow of Long Night Flint
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Lighting a lamp can dispel darkness, and so the people of the borderlands believed that as long as the lamps of the Lightkeepers were lit, the home of the living would be free of evil spirits.
The warriors who had sworn to watch over the night believed the same. That is why, like moths to a flame, man faced a mountain of evil clad in armor to protect his fragile flesh.
Until the black tide consumes his flesh, or his flesh devours the black tide, the two cannot be told apart.

customize.name: Flare of Long Night Flint
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The insignia of the Lightkeepers is a nightingale holding a burning wick in its beak.
It is said that in the past, the nightingale insignia belonged to a renowned noble house in the northern kingdom. In the shadow untouched by light, a boy, who would become a legendary thief, carved his first raven insignia with his friend in imitation of the nightingale.
But that was many years ago. Nowadays, the raven insignia can be seen everywhere, but the nightingale that the raven once looked up to still dwells on its tower, lamenting the winter city to the light.

customize.name: Blaze of Long Night Flint
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
In the long years when the night grasped the land, the first Torchforger lit the flames that dispelled the darkness and swore vigilance against the black tide, so earning the royal edict that established the Lightkeepers.
Unlike the Marechaussee Hunters of the high seas, the Lightkeepers who patrolled the night did not possess any ancient techniques from a lost empire, or prestigious titles and ranks. All they could rely on was weak flesh clad in silver armor, the swords and lamps in their hands, and an ancient oath passed down through generations.
No matter how many souls perish beneath the dim light, the dark disaster cannot overturn mortal resolve — for the long night can only steal life, and not the dawn that will eventually rise.

customize.name: Teachings of Moonlight
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Moonlight" is the blessing of the land beneath the moon.
Things come in all sizes, and people come in all states of wisdom. Yet under the moonlight, all are equal.

customize.name: Guide to Moonlight
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Moonlight" is the blessing of the land beneath the moon.
The cloud-veiled moonlight glows but faintly over the boundless dark wilds. Yet its fragile glimmer is a guide through the endless night.

customize.name: Philosophies of Moonlight
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Moonlight" is the blessing of the land beneath the moon.
Praying to the new moon for guidance and fortune is a rite passed down from the days of the first people. Tonight's moonlight seems no different from any other night, yet where is the new moon that people once looked to?

customize.name: Teachings of Elysium
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Elysium" is the dream of the land beneath the moon.
There are those who are desperate to get in, and those who are desperate to get out. Perhaps Elysium is not a place one can ever truly reach.

customize.name: Guide to Elysium
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Elysium" is the dream of the land beneath the moon.
To create a paradise without borders or distinctions upon a land overflowing with bitterness and sorrow — though it might be but a childish delusion, it may yet be a foundation for the future.

customize.name: Philosophies of Elysium
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Elysium" is the dream of the land beneath the moon.
Seldom do we share the same dreams of paradise. For those who wish not to settle for the present, there is no greater paradise than Nod-Krai. Yet for all the rest, the truth is quite the opposite.

customize.name: Teachings of Vagrancy
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Vagrancy" is the living of the land beneath the moon.
Enjoy a moment's respite, then depart before the sky turns black. Dawn is not the end, but the beginning of another journey.

customize.name: Guide to Vagrancy
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Vagrancy" is the living of the land beneath the moon.
To live is to wander, for none of us can settle in this world. What is remembered is not the moment of arrival, but the footprints that we leave along the way.

customize.name: Philosophies of Vagrancy
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
"Vagrancy" is the living of the land beneath the moon.
Through thunder and storms, across mountains and snowfields, though scarred and weary, the wanderer does not stop — nor will they till they find a place to call home.

customize.name: Luna Sigil
customize.desc:
A sigil that serves as a sign of recognition from the flowing moonlight of the borderlands.
Offer it to the Meeting Point to receive the rewards from moonlight.

customize.name: Evermoon Seal
customize.desc:
Collect all 3 seals to unlock the treasure vault on Lempo Isle.

You found this round, marked stone by chance while exploring. If you collect three with the same markings, you may be able to piece together a shadow of the bright moon that once illuminated the world.

customize.name: Evermoon Seal
customize.desc:
Collect all 3 seals to unlock the treasure vault on Paha Isle.

You found this round, marked stone by chance while exploring. If you collect three with the same markings, you may be able to piece together a shadow of the bright moon that once illuminated the world.

customize.name: Evermoon Seal
customize.desc:
Collect all 3 seals to unlock the treasure vault on Hiisi Island.

You found this round, marked stone by chance while exploring. If you collect three with the same markings, you may be able to piece together a shadow of the bright moon that once illuminated the world.

customize.name: Borderland Shrine of Depths Key
customize.desc:
A key that can break the seal on the ancient Shrines of Depths scattered around Nod-Krai.
These Shrines of Depths sealed themselves off when the civilization that built them was lost. Keys lost deep within domains are able to break the seals. Or perhaps that, for a moment, these keys help the seals to forget all that they have lost.

customize.name: Lunoculus
customize.desc: A substance that has accumulated intense kuuvahki energy. Offer it to the Statue of the New Moon and help reinstate the power it has lost over the years.

customize.name: Luna Treasure Compass
customize.desc:
A compass that can be used in Nod-Krai to search for nearby treasures and relevant clues.
This sublunary sphere holds countless unknown treasures, waiting to be discovered by adventurers with courage or wit.

customize.name: Moongleam Sapling
customize.desc:
If you can stay within the Ideal Tension Zone while fishing, this rod will shorten the time in which fish will struggle by a stable amount and increase your chances of success. This effect only works in Nod-Krai.

A fishing rod that shimmers with a pure, silvery glow, like moonlight caught in its frame. It's a masterpiece reserved for true masters among Nod-Krai's anglers, those who have reached the highest levels of the craft. It is said that the last wielder of this rod treated every catch as a quiet exchange rather than a contest. Some fish were released right away, while others were invited home for a short visit in the aquarium — before being gently returned to the waters they came from. This thoughtful, respectful way of fishing gave rise to a unique tradition among local anglers — one that values connection and care over mere skill.

customize.name: Ujola Cat
customize.desc:
A mysterious mechanical being, much like a cat.
It is a gift from the Voynich Guild that was unearthed from an ancient ruin dating back to the pioneering age. According to an anonymous informant, the inscription at the excavation site once bore the word "Ujola," but it weathered away shortly after being uncovered. To this day, the meaning of the name remains uncertain.
Perhaps it was simply a cat named "Ujola," or it once belonged to someone by that name. Records from the Akademiya show that this name once belonged to a student from Nod-Krai many years ago. The truth is probably simple — after all, it's just a name paired with a cat. What more profound meaning could there possibly be?

customize.name: Rotor Hovering Daybed
customize.desc:
The Voynich Guild developed this hovering daybed using artifacts unearthed from the pioneering age.
Once activated, it hovers slightly above ground, allowing you to rest on it anywhere in the wild. A remarkable creation indeed!
Despite the Voynich Guild's best efforts at reverse-engineering, the daybed remains somewhat unstable — the technology of the pioneering age remains unfathomable to this day.
It is said that when the earliest hovering daybed was discovered, it was buried alongside a mechanical cat, leading some to call it the "King Size Cat Bed."
"No! It couldn't possibly be a cat bed. Everyone knows cats don't sleep in their own beds!"

customize.name: Sigurd
customize.desc: A valiant warrior who resisted the dark calamity in ancient days. Though his life's spark has been extinguished, his unbending will has yet to fade, and those who swore to become hunters of the Wild Hunt continue his endless battle even today. The dark abyss's corrosion has seeped into his marrow, causing him to lose his way, but the desire to defend hearth and home will surely reignite, reawakening him to continue a bitter, eternal battle.

customize.name: Raskolnikov
customize.desc: Employed at the titanic Kuuvahki Experimental Design Bureau, Poruchik Raskolnikov fulfills his role as a cog in the machine perfectly, executing every order without question, and doing his duty in silence and with precision.

customize.name: Crab Tsar
customize.desc: Its mind infected by ancient moonlight, this ruler of crabs was plunged for a time into delirium and madness. But just as it was about to unleash its might, it suffered a crushing defeat at the hands of a thief who broke into its court, rendering it more agreeable. Even so, this crustacean suzerain yet yearns to clash pincers with strong foes, longing to triumph over opponents worthy of its full might.

customize.name: Gleaming Charge: Frostnight Scion
customize.desc:
An elegant elemental life form that possesses immense elemental affinity. The long years have exposed it to high concentrations of Electro, resulting in its present form.
One of the manifestations with the most violent temperament, it commands steel-shattering bolts of lightning like mere servants, such that any land it passes through shall be marked as if by a marauding, thunderous calamity.
In still-extant prayers of the far north, it was born from the Frost Moon's blessings, symbolizing the pure source and the first radiance. Perhaps this is why it finds the tainting of its pale purity with the seven colors of heavenly light unbearable, thus rejecting all life that draws too close.

customize.name: Tangled Vines: Frostnight Scion
customize.desc:
An elegant elemental life form that possesses immense elemental affinity. The long years have exposed it to high concentrations of Dendro, resulting in its present form.
This entity has a marvelous resonance with the plant life of the groves. Some say that one of the Moonchanters once made a contract with the wooded lands with their help, thus becoming a friend and companion to all life on this land.
In still-extant prayers of the far north, it was born from the Frost Moon's blessings, symbolizing the pure source and the first radiance. Perhaps this is why it finds the tainting of its pale purity with the seven colors of heavenly light unbearable, thus rejecting all life that draws too close.

customize.name: Blazing Brilliance: Frostnight Scion
customize.desc:
An elegant elemental life form that possesses immense elemental affinity. The long years have exposed it to high concentrations of Pyro, resulting in its present form.
One of the manifestations with the most violent temperament, even at the frigid edges of the world, it is wreathed in unquenchable flame.
In still-extant prayers of the far north, it was born from the Frost Moon's blessings, symbolizing the pure source and the first radiance. Perhaps this is why it finds the tainting of its pale purity with the seven colors of heavenly light unbearable, thus rejecting all life that draws too close.

customize.name: Icy Crystal: Frostnight Scion
customize.desc:
An elegant elemental life form that possesses immense elemental affinity. The long years have exposed it to high concentrations of Cryo, resulting in its present form.
It is said that this entity is closest to the original form of a Frostnight Scion. It will use icy mists and crystals to set up redoubtable walls, but perhaps it does this only to separate the flawless primeval light from the world that lies beneath the moon.
In still-extant prayers of the far north, it was born from the Frost Moon's blessings, symbolizing the pure source and the first radiance. Perhaps this is why it finds the tainting of its pale purity with the seven colors of heavenly light unbearable, thus rejecting all life that draws too close.

customize.name: Wilderness Exile
customize.desc:
A ghoul that stalks the frozen wilderness when the pitch-dark mist rolls in. Their emergence presages worse calamities to come.
All who dwell beneath the moon set out on journeys with their own goals and wishes in mind, but not all such wishes receive favor. Spirits that cannot rest due to engendered resentment, partings with loved ones, or desires that go unfulfilled, if corrupted by the Abyss, may transform into ghouls, forever lost in the thick mists of the Wild Hunt.

customize.name: Wilderness Hunter
customize.desc:
A ghoul that stalks the frozen wilderness when the pitch-dark mist rolls in. Their emergence presages worse calamities to come.
Many great champions of a lost ancient kingdom lie buried beneath the frozen northlands. Though the remnants of the past have been long wiped clean, these noble spirits yet defend their golden homeland. Awakened by Abyssal taint, these warriors now see all who trespass as prey.

customize.name: Radiant Antelope
customize.desc:
A beast that has undergone a unique evolution due to age-long immersion in the ancient moon's power.
Strange lightning once fell upon the land blessed by moonlight, causing once ordinary antelopes to gain the power to wield lightning. They say that some have seen a truly strange sight — antelopes standing on cliffs at the convergence of a storm, attracting bolts of lightning to temper their bodies.

customize.name: Radiant Bladehorn
customize.desc:
A beast that has undergone a unique evolution due to age-long immersion in the ancient moon's power.
It is said that in the ancient past, when these borderlands were still shrouded by the pitch-dark shadow, only the charging of the giant rhinos could return the power that makes all things turn... And this was all that was asked of them in return for the moonlight shining down its blessings.

customize.name: Radiant Lunapod
customize.desc:
A beast that has undergone a unique evolution due to age-long immersion in the ancient moon's power.
Legend has it that when the waves of calamity rolled over the land, even those animals who dwelled in the Forsaken Sea were not spared. Those who could not accept the moonlight into themselves vanished like foam, whether great sea serpents who could send waves skyward, or single-eyed monsters who once plotted to consume all things.

customize.name: Oprichniki Line Trooper
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with a gunblade and tasked to hold the line as the resilient backbone of the Oprichniki forces.
According to Snezhnayan infantry manuals, the primary duties of line troops are merely to aim, shoot, and charge. Even should the individual soldier's combat power not prove exceptional, soldiers of the line in tight formation remain a key foundation of the Snezhnayan military machine.

customize.name: Oprichniki Support Trooper
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with a heavy shield and tasked to fight at the very front to protect their comrades.
Many understand that in the long war between Snezhnaya and the dark calamity, only the side that holds out with greater resolution can outlast the other and emerge victorious. The ultimate resolution of the Oprichniki is, undoubtedly, the shield that protects their forces — so long as this shield does not fall, there is always hope for victory.

customize.name: Oprichniki Grenadier
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with a man-portable grenade launcher that can perform close-range bombardment.
Though the Oprichniki has large-scale, fully-functional fire support attachments, the commanding staff still advocates for large numbers of grenadiers to be maintained. After all, no big gun can compare in surety at the very front lines of combat to a grenade launcher you can direct at will.

customize.name: Oprichniki Vanguard
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with engineering tools and highly adept in close-range combat.
To meet the demands of battlefield operations, the Fatui Oprichniki established vanguard units, tasked with clearing the path of obstacles for advancing forces. As for exactly what counts as an obstacle, that hardly matters. Be it an impassable ravine or a formidable foe standing in their way, they will remove it without hesitation — whatever it takes to ensure the banner of the Pale Star marches on.

customize.name: Oprichniki Medic
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with a staff-like device and tasked with providing emergency medical support to their comrades in arms.
In truth, these medics have largely only taken crash-course training, and as such, their healing abilities are limited. In practice, they tend to adopt more efficient methods of supporting their allies — mixing in with the different units and charging at the enemy lines.

customize.name: Oprichniki Bombardier
customize.desc:
A soldier of the Fatui Oprichniki, equipped with a specialized hover pack and explosive charges, and tasked with performing breaching operations.
As troops with immense breakthrough potential, bombardiers are often sent to the most dire of battlefields, making them the troops who gain meritorious promotions most quickly. It is said that Oprichniki officers overwhelmingly come from the ranks of the bombardiers.

customize.name: Oprichniki Fireblade Shock Trooper
customize.desc:
An elite officer of the Fatui Oprichniki who specializes in close combat using a giant blade.
Whether it be in the war against the dark calamity or against those ignoramuses who dare stand against the Tsaritsa's ideals, those who breach at the tip of the spear suffer the greatest casualties. As such, those who survive multiple battles are naturally the elite of the elite. There will always be those willing to become the fire and sword of the empire, just as there will always be those who chafe against the injustice of fate and the inequity of the Old World.

customize.name: Oprichniki Hailstorm Cannoneer
customize.desc:
An elite officer of the Fatui Oprichniki who uses a heavy cannon to tear enemy formations apart while using a mighty shield to defend their comrades.
Bitter battles have dyed the shield frost white, while coatings of blood have tinted its edges black. Oprichniki officers know that empty words will never bring back those who have fallen in sacrifice — only a bombardment akin to a hailstorm can shake this defiled Old World.

customize.name: Oprichniki Thunderblitz Gvardiya
customize.desc:
An elite officer of the Fatui Oprichniki who specializes in using twin guns in combat.
Unlike their Skirmisher cousins, Oprichniki officers almost all hail from the Snezhnaya Royal Military Academy, whether due to the privilege of noble birth or the rare talent to escape a common background. After all, neither is truly different from the other within the Tsaritsa's beneficent, loving ideals. Traditionally, only fae could become elite Gvardiya, but today, this glorious role and title has been given to Oprichniki officers — a more equal division for the construction of a new world.

customize.name: Close Combat Storm Landcruiser
customize.desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
Equipped with Crawler Track Movement Mechanisms, these Landcruisers are normally used to storm enemy positions, where they can pass over rough terrain such as mud and melting snow despite heavy armor and armaments through their excellent load-bearing capabilities and off-road mobility. When close-combat Landcruisers approach enemy defensive lines in formation, rotating blades raised for battle, most foes will concentrate fire on them, allowing other units the opportunity to unleash their firepower...

customize.name: Close Combat Scout Landcruiser
customize.desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
These walking Landcruisers with bipedal structures are often used as "scouts," for they are able to quickly traverse rough terrain and reach key positions to seize the initiative for their allies. Their close-combat-oriented rotating blades allow them to deal fatal damage to their foes and shred shrubbery and obstacles to open the way, allowing units to operate with ease even amidst thick vegetation.

customize.name: Force Recon Storm Landcruiser
customize.desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
Equipped with Crawler Track Movement Mechanisms, these Landcruisers are normally used to storm enemy positions, where they can pass over rough terrain such as mud and melting snow despite heavy armor and armaments through their excellent load-bearing capabilities and off-road mobility. Force Recon armaments include a multi-barrel automatic gun, allowing this Landcruiser to adjust its tactics to both close quarters and long-range combat. Whether it be long-range observation or obtaining enemy intel in the midst of fearsome firefights, this Landcruiser model is more than up to the task.

customize.name: Force Recon Scout Landcruiser
customize.desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
These walking Landcruisers with bipedal structures are often used as "scouts," for they are able to quickly traverse rough terrain and reach key positions to seize the initiative for their allies. Equipped with Force Recon armaments, this Landcruiser can not only serve as a forward scout for the main force, but can also exploit openings and actively attack the enemy where their lines are weakest, thus playing a similar role to that of traditional cavalry...

customize.name: Force Recon Ground Effect Landcruiser
customize.desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
The ground effect Landcruiser is able to "fly" a certain distance above ground by maintaining lift and generating pressure differentials through firing high-speed jet sprays at the surface, allowing it to more economically achieve combat cruising speed, avoid mines and traps, and perform highly effective assaults. However, costs and limits on operation time mean that mass-produced models carry limited payloads. As such, they are currently limited to Force Recon roles...

customize.name: Cutting Edge All-Purpose Storm Landcruiser
customize.desc:
Balancing cutting-edge tech, production costs, and sortie rates, these elite Landcruisers confer immense penetrative power upon any order of battle, and are the key fulcrum of the frontline.
The all-purpose storm combat package combines multi-barrel automatic guns with close-quarter rotating blades, allowing this Landcruiser to battle opponents at any range, while heavy howitzers on both arms allow it to obliterate cover and deny defenders the benefit of their fortifications. According to combat doctrine co-authored by the Fatui and the Royal Military Academy, these Landcruisers must be supported by all nearby units when they attack, speedily punching a hole in enemy lines, which will allow for follow-up attacks in depth that will then cause the enemy defenses to collapse completely.

customize.name: Cutting Edge All-Purpose Scout Landcruiser
customize.desc:
Balancing cutting-edge tech, production costs, and sortie rates, these elite Landcruisers confer immense penetrative power upon any order of battle, and are the key fulcrum of the frontline.
The all-purpose scout combat package is designed for both long- and short-range combat, and not only leads scout Landcruiser squads, but also provides close support for All-Purpose Storm Landcruisers during high-intensity battles, such as crossing specialized anti-Landcruiser trenches, or destroying enemy strongpoints. This Landcruiser type can also keep up with the tip of the spear as it breaks through in depth, before swinging out to the wings and swiftly attacking key targets in the enemy's rear lines.

customize.name: Cutting Edge Fire Support Ground Effect Landcruiser
customize.desc:
Balancing cutting-edge tech, production costs, and sortie rates, these elite Landcruisers confer immense penetrative power upon any order of battle, and are the key fulcrum of the frontline.
After being equipped with high-efficiency jet engines, this Ground Effect Landcruiser has gained the ability to carry multiple armaments, allowing it to deliver this sizable firepower anywhere on the battlefield in a timely fashion. As such, the combat doctrine co-authored by the Fatui and the Royal Military Academy states that they are to be organized as a "Quick Reaction Force" in large-scale battles, meant to guard against enemy breakthroughs or counterattacks, and to press the advantage if the battle is going favorably. Of course, all such Landcruisers have the ability to operate independently, and on long tours of duty, they can form the core of a small squad and thus maximize the firepower of various Fatui unit types...

customize.name: Hazelnut Wood
customize.desc: Wood sourced from the Hazelnut Tree. Though the subspecies this wood comes from vary wildly in appearance, they mostly share the same unique compounds that offer excellent resistance to insects and decay, making it a remarkably durable material.

customize.name: Silver Fir Wood
customize.desc: Wood harvested from the Silver Fir Tree. Humans have favored this type of wood since ancient times for its wide range of uses, from crafting barrels to constructing frameworks.

customize.name: Alder Wood
customize.desc: Wood from the Alder Tree. It demonstrates considerable resistance to moisture and cold, making it a fine raw material for both furniture and musical instruments.

customize.name: Pedunculate Oak Wood
customize.desc: Wood sourced from the Pedunculate Oak Tree. While its density is relatively low, it boasts impressive toughness and water resistance, making it a common choice for buildings near bodies of water.

customize.name: Fatui
customize.desc: A Snezhnayan organization that is loyal to the Tsaritsa and has spread out all over the continent. Its Harbingers are on the hunt for the Gnoses.

customize.name: Adventurers' Guild
customize.desc: An organization based in Snezhnaya that recruits adventurers and accepts and distributes commissions. They have a representative office in every major city. Their motto is "Ad astra abyssosque!"

customize.name: Frostmoon Scions
customize.desc: The descendants of the legendary golden realm, who chose to find new homes among the mountains and forests after abandoning all civilization. The only thing they never forsook was their faith in the "Moon Goddess."

customize.name: Fae
customize.desc: Followers of the first Cryo Archon, the Belyi Tsar, who were created from the bones of giant beasts and fallen frostmoon light.

customize.name: Paha Isle
customize.desc: Once an unremarkable island known only for its sunset-hued salt marshes and blooming colonies of Tassel Jellies, everything changed when the heaviest fragment of the fallen moonstone crashed upon its shores.

customize.name: Lempo Isle
customize.desc: An island where the border town, Nasha Town, is located. It is said that Nasha Town was first built by a group of children. Whenever they had a decision to make, they'd blow into a conch shell to gather the group, and everyone would vote on it.

customize.name: Hiisi Island
customize.desc: A mysterious island shrouded in ancient forests, where worship of the Moon Goddess endures. Legends tell of the golden realm's descendants who, guided by moonlight, journeyed countless miles to finally find refuge on these shores.

customize.name: Polkka Beneath the Moon's Oracle
customize.desc: Explore Hiisi Island and uncover the fragments scattered across the island.

customize.name: Colors of Emptiness
customize.desc: Follow two strange light orbs to color the Nothing Passage.

customize.name: East of the Moon, West of the Sun
customize.desc: Meet various people around Nod-Krai, in search of Proofs of the Cognoscenti.

customize.name: The Stress of Changing Careers
customize.desc: At the northern training ground, you’re suddenly stopped by a treasure hunter who seems very enthusiastic…

customize.name: Blessings of the Frost Moon
customize.desc: You encounter Lauma, who is deep in thought, at the Frostmoon Enclave...

imgDesc.text: "O Moon, benevolent mistress, whither dost thou lead us?"
Mortals often birth wishes from pain, and faith from wishes. Yet if faith need not always be given to illusory beings, why carve cold, silent stone into shapes from dreams and ballads?
And still the moonlight flows as ever.
"We are all tainted by sin... How could we ever hope to behold the moonlight in its purest form?"

Steel structures rise from this pink geological layer like jarring notes in a melody. Mysterious lifeforms once dwelled here — mindless and voiceless, they lived without sound and vanished in silence.
Clink, clank, clink, clank! Countless mechanical creations, both large and small, are brought into existence here — along with the irresistible aroma of freshly made krumkakes!
This town sits like a ship run aground on the world's edge — a place where drifters gather to scavenge fragments of elysium from the wreckage of history and fabricated pasts.

This leviathan forged of white iron and black steel hungrily devours all in its sight – energy, blood, and tears alike. Yet what it seeks is not plunder, but power enough to withstand the looming calamity.

Just as the frontier folk weave their prayers into verse beneath the moonlight, the craftsmen of the north temper defiant ambition into steel as cold and bright as moonlight.
When the moon sets alongside the long night, the thing that tears apart the old world may well be hailed as the dawn of a new one.
A massive vessel containing captured moonlight.
They defined life with human arrogance, yet could not define the end of their own.

Its heart, made of colossal gears, has long since stopped beating. Its steel veins have rusted through. Until one day, someone calls it forth from slumber, and the great beast exhales toward the stars, letting out a long, satin-like breath.
Many have strode resolutely into darkness, that their homeland's light might endure.
